channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bank of America tops estimates on better-than-expected investment banking, interest income
item.description: Bank of America's results hinge on interest rates and their impact on net interest income.

item.title: Sterling Could Stay Weaker in Near-Term After U.K. GDP Data Misses Forecasts
item.description: Sterling fell against the dollar and could stay under pressure in the near term after U.K. economic growth data Thursday missed expectations, Monex Eu...

item.title: StockFutures Gain as More Bank Earnings Loom
item.description: Stock futures were are ticking higher amid another round of bank earnings and December retail sales.

item.title: Goldman backs up our bank stock shuffle with strong earnings, upbeat M&A outlook
item.description: Shares popped roughly 6% to more than $600 apiece after a fourth-quarter revenue and earnings beat.

item.title: What Happens When Your House Burns Down and You Still Have a Mortgage?
item.description: Borrowers are still on the hook but might be able to pause payments.

item.title: Shares of Cartier owner Richemont jump 17% as sales rise in December quarter
item.description: Cartier owner Richemont on Thursday reported a 10% increase in third quarter sales even as China demand weighed.

item.title: TSMC net profit hits record high as fourth-quarter results top expectations on robust AI chip demand
item.description: TSMC, the world's largest contract chip manufacturer, produces advanced processors for clients such as Nvidia and Apple and has benefited from the meg...

item.title: Citigroup swings to fourth-quarter profit, tops estimates on investment banking strength
item.description: The fourth-quarter report comes after a year where Citi's stock rose almost 37%, outperforming the S&P 500.

item.title: Wall Street Thinks U.S. Homes Are Overpriced
item.description: Housing could be overvalued by anywhere from 10% to 25% based on how investors are acting.

item.title: Europe Needs to Boost LNG Imports to Meet Storage Targets, MUFG Says --- Market Talk
item.description: Gas prices in Europe were weaker in early trade, and the continent will need to import around 30% more LNG on an annualized basis before the start of ...
